title: XKCD
tagline: A webcomic of romance, sarcasm, math, and language
description:
A comic featuring mostly unrelated strips, usually employing a form of geeky humor.

XKCD has had tremendous real-world influence for a webcomic, spawning hundreds of user-created enactments of the comic's themes, jokes, and songs. It is even the direct origin of a module in the Python programming language.

title: Questionable Content
description:
A mostly continuous story about young people in a small town in Massachusetts, USA. The story is set in a near-future society where robots are commonplace, but most of the story still revolves around humans and their interactions.

The comic is sometimes interspersed with random filler art

title: Oglaf
description: A gag comic with most of its humor centered around adult-oriented themes, often accompanied by graphical nudity. Comics are one pane by default, but may have up to 8.

title: A Softer World
description: Photographs are overlaid with text to produce comics usually consisting of 3 visually related panels, with a harsh textual punchline in the last. Prominently features very dark humor, often hinting at suicide, homicide, and desperation.

title: Alice Grove
description: A mostly continuous story about a post-apocalyptic world reset to medieval technology. The titular character Alice, a superhuman survivor of the apocalypse a long time ago, must solve the mystery of why two aliens have landed in her village.

title: Girls With Slingshots
description: A continuous story about a down-and-out twentysomething who struggles to get her life on the rails. Hazel might very well be an alcoholic.

title: Dinosaur Comics
description:
The same basic graphic art is overlaid with absurd conversations between a few dinosaurs.

The main character is a childlike Tyrannosaurus Rex who wonders about perceived absurdities and drives them to the extreme.
